title: Rule
text: For purposes of section38, the biodiesel fuels credit determined under this section for the taxable year is an amount equal to the sum of——the biodiesel mixture credit, plus—the biodiesel credit, plus—in the case of an eligible small agri-biodiesel producer, the small agri-biodiesel producer credit.

logical_structure.result: For purposes of section38, the biodiesel fuels credit determined under this section for the taxable year is an amount equal to the sum of——the biodiesel mixture credit, plus—the biodiesel credit, plus—in the case of an eligible small agri-biodiesel producer, the small agri-biodiesel producer credit.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 40A(a)General Rule—For purposes of section38, the biodiesel fuels credit determined under this section for the taxable year is
                  an amount equal to the sum of—I.R.C. § 40A(a)(1)—the biodiesel mixture credit, plusI.R.C. § 40A(a)(2)—the biodiesel credit, plusI.R.C. § 40A(a)(3)—in the case of an eligible small agri-biodiesel producer, the small agri-biodiesel
                     producer credit.

title: General
text: The biodiesel mixture credit of any taxpayer for any taxable year is $1.00 for each gallon of biodiesel used by the taxpayer in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture.

logical_structure.result: The biodiesel mixture credit of any taxpayer for any taxable year is $1.00 for each gallon of biodiesel used by the taxpayer in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 40A(b)(1)(A)In General—The biodiesel mixture credit of any taxpayer for any taxable year is $1.00 for each
                        gallon of biodiesel used by the taxpayer in the production of a qualified biodiesel
                        mixture.

title: Biodiesel Mixture
text: The term “qualified biodiesel mixture” means a mixture of biodiesel and diesel fuel (as defined in section4083(a)(3)), determined without regard to any use of kerosene, which——is sold by the taxpayer producing such mixture to any person for use as a fuel, or—is used as a fuel by the taxpayer producing such mixture.

logical_structure.result: The term “qualified biodiesel mixture” means a mixture of biodiesel and diesel fuel (as defined in section4083(a)(3)), determined without regard to any use of kerosene, which——is sold by the taxpayer producing such mixture to any person for use as a fuel, or—is used as a fuel by the taxpayer producing such mixture.

title: Or Use Must Be In Trade Or Business, Etc.
text: Biodiesel used in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture shall be taken into account——only if the sale or use described in subparagraph(B)is in a trade or business of the taxpayer, and—for the taxable year in which such sale or use occurs.
conditions: the sale or use described in subparagraph(B)is in a trade or business of the taxpayer, and—for the taxable year in which such sale or use occurs.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 40A(b)(1)(C)Sale Or Use Must Be In Trade Or Business, Etc.—Biodiesel used in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture shall be taken into
                        account—I.R.C. § 40A(b)(1)(C)(i)—only if the sale or use described in subparagraph(B)is in a trade or business of the taxpayer, andI.R.C. § 40A(b)(1)(C)(ii)—for the taxable year in which such sale or use occurs.

title: Off
text: Farm Production Not Eligible—No credit shall be allowed under this section with respect to any casual off-farm production of a qualified biodiesel mixture.

logical_structure.result: Farm Production Not Eligible—No credit shall be allowed under this section with respect to any casual off-farm production of a qualified biodiesel mixture.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 40A(b)(1)(D)Casual Off-Farm Production Not Eligible—No credit shall be allowed under this section with respect to any casual off-farm
                        production of a qualified biodiesel mixture.

title: General
text: The biodiesel credit of any taxpayer for any taxable year is $1.00 for each gallon of biodiesel which is not in a mixture with diesel fuel and which during the taxable year——is used by the taxpayer as a fuel in a trade or business, or—is sold by the taxpayer at retail to a person and placed in the fuel tank of such person's vehicle.

logical_structure.result: The biodiesel credit of any taxpayer for any taxable year is $1.00 for each gallon of biodiesel which is not in a mixture with diesel fuel and which during the taxable year——is used by the taxpayer as a fuel in a trade or business, or—is sold by the taxpayer at retail to a person and placed in the fuel tank of such person's vehicle.

title: Credit Not To Apply To Biodiesel Sold At Retail
text: No credit shall be allowed under subparagraph(A)(i)with respect to any biodiesel which was sold in a retail sale described in subparagraph(A)(ii).

logical_structure.result: No credit shall be allowed under subparagraph(A)(i)with respect to any biodiesel which was sold in a retail sale described in subparagraph(A)(ii).

raw_text: I.R.C. § 40A(b)(2)(B)User Credit Not To Apply To Biodiesel Sold At Retail—No credit shall be allowed under subparagraph(A)(i)with respect to any biodiesel which was sold in a retail sale described in subparagraph(A)(ii).

title: For Biodiesel
text: No credit shall be allowed under paragraph(1)or(2)of subsection(a)unless the taxpayer obtains a certification (in such form and manner as prescribed by the Secretary) from the producer or importer of the biodiesel which identifies the product produced and the percentage of biodiesel and agri-biodiesel in the product.
conditions: the taxpayer obtains a certification (in such form and manner as prescribed by the Secretary) from the producer or importer of the biodiesel which identifies the product produced and the percentage of biodiesel and agri-biodiesel in the product.

unless: the taxpayer obtains a certification (in such form and manner as prescribed by the Secretary) from the producer or importer of the biodiesel which identifies the product produced and the percentage of biodiesel and agri-biodiesel in the product.
logical_structure.result: No credit shall be allowed under paragraph(1)or(2)of subsection(a)

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 40A(b)(3)Certification For Biodiesel—No credit shall be allowed under paragraph(1)or(2)of subsection(a)unless the taxpayer obtains a certification (in such form and manner as prescribed
                     by the Secretary) from the producer or importer of the biodiesel which identifies
                     the product produced and the percentage of biodiesel and agri-biodiesel in the product.

title: General
text: The small agri-biodiesel producer credit of any eligible small agri-biodiesel producer for any taxable year is 20 cents for each gallon of qualified agri-biodiesel production of such producer.

logical_structure.result: The small agri-biodiesel producer credit of any eligible small agri-biodiesel producer for any taxable year is 20 cents for each gallon of qualified agri-biodiesel production of such producer.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 40A(b)(4)(A)In General—The small agri-biodiesel producer credit of any eligible small agri-biodiesel producer
                        for any taxable year is 20 cents for each gallon of qualified agri-biodiesel production
                        of such producer.

title: Agri
text: Biodiesel Production—For purposes of this paragraph, the term “qualified agri-biodiesel production” means any agri-biodiesel which is produced by an eligible small agri-biodiesel producer in a manner which complies with the requirements undersection 45Z(f)(1)(A)(iii), and which during the taxable year——is sold by such producer to another person——for use by such other person in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture in such other person's trade or business (other than casual off-farm production),—for use by such other person as a fuel in a trade or business, or—who sells such agri-biodiesel at retail to another person and places such agri-biodiesel in the fuel tank of such other person, or—is used or sold by such producer for any purpose described in clause (i).

logical_structure.result: Biodiesel Production—For purposes of this paragraph, the term “qualified agri-biodiesel production” means any agri-biodiesel which is produced by an eligible small agri-biodiesel producer in a manner which complies with the requirements undersection 45Z(f)(1)(A)(iii), and which during the taxable year——is sold by such producer to another person——for use by such other person in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture in such other person's trade or business (other than casual off-farm production),—for use by such other person as a fuel in a trade or business, or—who sells such agri-biodiesel at retail to another person and places such agri-biodiesel in the fuel tank of such other person, or—is used or sold by such producer for any purpose described in clause (i).

                              such other person's trade or business (other than casual off-farm production),I.R.C. § 40A(b)(4)(B)(i)(II)—for use by such other person as a fuel in a trade or business, orI.R.C. § 40A(b)(4)(B)(i)(III)—who sells such agri-biodiesel at retail to another person and places such agri-biodiesel
                              in the fuel tank of such other person, orI.R.C. § 40A(b)(4)(B)(ii)—is used or sold by such producer for any purpose described in clause (i).

text: The qualified agri-biodiesel production of any producer for any taxable year shall not exceed 15,000,000 gallons.

logical_structure.result: The qualified agri-biodiesel production of any producer for any taxable year shall not exceed 15,000,000 gallons.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 40A(b)(4)(C)Limitation—The qualified agri-biodiesel production of any producer for any taxable year shall
                        not exceed 15,000,000 gallons.

title: With Clean Fuel Production Credit
text: The credit determined under this paragraph with respect to any gallon of fuel shall be in addition to any credit determined undersection 45Zwith respect to such gallon of fuel.

logical_structure.result: The credit determined under this paragraph with respect to any gallon of fuel shall be in addition to any credit determined undersection 45Zwith respect to such gallon of fuel.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 40A(b)(4)(D)Coordination With Clean Fuel Production Credit—The credit determined under this paragraph with respect to any gallon of fuel shall
                        be in addition to any credit determined undersection 45Zwith respect to such gallon of fuel.

title: With Credit Against Excise Tax
text: The amount of the credit determined under this section with respect to any biodiesel shall be properly reduced to take into account any benefit provided with respect to such biodiesel solely by reason of the application of section6426or6427(e).

logical_structure.result: The amount of the credit determined under this section with respect to any biodiesel shall be properly reduced to take into account any benefit provided with respect to such biodiesel solely by reason of the application of section6426or6427(e).

                  such biodiesel solely by reason of the application of section6426or6427(e).

text: The term “biodiesel” means the monoalkyl esters of long chain fatty acids derived from plant or animal matter which meet——the registration requirements for fuels and fuel additives established by the Environmental Protection Agency under section 211 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545), and—the requirements of the American Society of Testing and Materials D6751.Such term shall not include any liquid with respect to which a credit may be determined under section40or40B.

text: The term “agri-biodiesel” means biodiesel derived solely from virgin oils, including esters derived from virgin vegetable oils from corn, soybeans, sunflower seeds, cottonseeds, canola, crambe, rapeseeds, safflowers, flaxseeds, rice bran, mustard seeds, and camelina, and from animal fats.

text: If——any credit was determined under this section with respect to biodiesel used in the production of any qualified biodiesel mixture, and—any person——separates the biodiesel from the mixture, or—without separation, uses the mixture other than as a fuel,then there is hereby imposed on such person a tax equal to the product of the rate applicable under subsection(b)(1)(A)and the number of gallons of such biodiesel in such mixture.

text: If——any credit was determined under this section with respect to the retail sale of any biodiesel, and—any person mixes such biodiesel or uses such biodiesel other than as a fuel,then there is hereby imposed on such person a tax equal to the product of the rate applicable under subsection(b)(2)(A)and the number of gallons of such biodiesel.

title: Credit
text: If——any credit was determined under subsection(a)(3), and—any person does not use such fuel for a purpose described in subsection(b)(4)(B),then there is hereby imposed on such person a tax equal to 10 cents a gallon for each gallon of such agri-biodiesel.
conditions: ——any credit was determined under subsection(a)(3), and—any person does not use such fuel for a purpose described in subsection(b)(4)(B),then there is hereby imposed on such person a tax equal to 10 cents a gallon for each gallon of such agri-biodiesel.

title: Laws
text: All provisions of law, including penalties, shall, insofar as applicable and not inconsistent with this section, apply in respect of any tax imposed under subparagraph(A)or(B)as if such tax were imposed by section4081and not by this chapter.

title: In The Case Of Estates And Trusts
text: Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, rules similar to the rules of subsection(d)of section52shall apply.

logical_structure.result: Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, rules similar to the rules of subsection(d)of section52shall apply.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 40A(d)(4)Pass-Thru In The Case Of Estates And Trusts—Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, rules similar to the rules of subsection(d)of section52shall apply.

title: To Biodiesel With Connection To The United States
text: No credit shall be determined under this section with respect to any biodiesel which is produced outside the United States for use as a fuel outside the United States. For purposes of this paragraph, the term “United States” includes any possession of the United States.

logical_structure.result: No credit shall be determined under this section with respect to any biodiesel which is produced outside the United States for use as a fuel outside the United States. For purposes of this paragraph, the term “United States” includes any possession of the United States.

raw_text:

                     is produced outside the United States for use as a fuel outside the United States.
                     For purposes of this paragraph, the term “United States” includes any possession of
                     the United States.

title: Small Agri
text: Biodiesel Producer—The term “eligible small agri-biodiesel producer” means a person who, at all times during the taxable year, has a productive capacity for agri-biodiesel not in excess of 60,000,000 gallons.

title: Rule
text: For purposes of the 15,000,000 gallon limitation under subsection(b)(4)(C)and the 60,000,000 gallon limitation under paragraph(1), all members of the same controlled group of corporations (within the meaning of section267(f)) and all persons under common control (within the meaning of section52(b)but determined by treating an interest of more than 50 percent as a controlling interest) shall be treated as 1 person.

                     section267(f)) and all persons under common control (within the meaning of section52(b)but determined by treating an interest of more than 50 percent as a controlling interest)
                     shall be treated as 1 person.

title: , S Corporation, And Other Pass
text: Thru Entities—In the case of a partnership, trust, S corporation, or other pass-thru entity, the limitations contained in subsection(b)(4)(C)and paragraph(1)shall be applied at the entity level and at the partner or similar level.

text: For purposes of this subsection, in the case of a facility in which more than 1 person has an interest, productive capacity shall be allocated among such persons in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe.

text: The Secretary may prescribe such regulations as may be necessary——to prevent the credit provided for in subsection(a)(3)from directly or indirectly benefiting any person with a direct or indirect productive capacity of more than 60,000,000 gallons of agri-biodiesel during the taxable year, or—to prevent any person from directly or indirectly benefiting with respect to more than 15,000,000 gallons during the taxable year.

                        capacity of more than 60,000,000 gallons of agri-biodiesel during the taxable year,
                        orI.R.C. § 40A(e)(5)(B)—to prevent any person from directly or indirectly benefiting with respect to more

title: General
text: In the case of a cooperative organization described in section1381(a), any portion of the credit determined under subsection(a)(3)for the taxable year may, at the election of the organization, be apportioned pro rata among patrons of the organization on the basis of the quantity or value of business done with or for such patrons for the taxable year.

logical_structure.result: In the case of a cooperative organization described in section1381(a), any portion of the credit determined under subsection(a)(3)for the taxable year may, at the election of the organization, be apportioned pro rata among patrons of the organization on the basis of the quantity or value of business done with or for such patrons for the taxable year.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 40A(e)(6)(A)(i)In General—In the case of a cooperative organization described in section1381(a), any portion of the credit determined under subsection(a)(3)for the taxable year may, at the election of the organization, be apportioned pro
                           rata among patrons of the organization on the basis of the quantity or value of business
                           done with or for such patrons for the taxable year.

title: And Effect Of Election
text: An election under clause(i)for any taxable year shall be made on a timely filed return for such year. Such election, once made, shall be irrevocable for such taxable year. Such election shall not take effect unless the organization designates the apportionment as such in a written notice mailed to its patrons during the payment period described in section1382(d).

title: Rules For Decrease In Credits For Taxable Year
text: If the amount of the credit of the organization determined under such subsection for a taxable year is less than the amount of such credit shown on the return of the organization for such year, an amount equal to the excess of——such reduction, over—the amount not apportioned to such patrons under subparagraph(A)for the taxable year,shall be treated as an increase in tax imposed by this chapter on the organization. Such increase shall not be treated as tax imposed by this chapter for purposes of determining the amount of any credit under this chapter or for purposes of section55.

Such increase shall not be treated as tax imposed by this chapter for purposes of determining the amount of any credit under this chapter or for purposes of section55.

title: In The Same Manner As Biodiesel

raw_text: I.R.C. § 40A(f)(2)Exception—Subsection(b)(4)shall not apply with respect to renewable diesel.

title: Diesel Defined
text: Diesel Defined—The term “renewable diesel” means liquid fuel derived from biomass which meets——the registration requirements for fuels and fuel additives established by the Environmental Protection Agency under section 211 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545), and—the requirements of the American Society of Testing and Materials D975 or D396, or other equivalent standard approved by the Secretary.Such term shall not include any liquid with respect to which a credit may be determined under section40. Such term does not include any fuel derived from coprocessing biomass with a feedstock which is not biomass. For purposes of this paragraph, the term “biomass” has the meaning given such term by section45K(c)(3).

For purposes of this paragraph, the term “biomass” has the meaning given such term by section45K(c)(3).
